length.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the measurement of how long something is from one end to the other
length.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We measured the length and width of the living room.
Some fish can grow to a length of four feet.
a length of 1 metre/2 feet etc
The hotel pool is 15 metres in length.
You’ll need several pieces of string of different lengths.
length.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the amount of time that you spend doing something or that something continues
length.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He wasn’t left alone for any length of time.
Your pension will depend on your length of employment.
What’s the average length of stay in hospital?
length.translation[0].definitions[1].not: In everyday English, people usually talk about how long something is in space or time, rather than using the noun length:
length.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the amount of writing in a book, or the amount of time that a film, play etc continues
length.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We had to cut the length of the book by one third.
Films of this length  (=as long as this) are pretty unusual.
length.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a piece of something long and thin
length.translation[0].definitions[4].def: the measurement of a horse, boat etc from one end to the other – used when saying how far the horse, boat etc is ahead of another
length.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: The horse won by three lengths.
length.translation[0].definitions[5].def: the distance from one end of a swimming pool to the other
length.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: She does at least 20 lengths a day.
length.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: measure the length of something
The children measured the length of their shadows at three different times of day.
have a length of 1 metre/2 feet etc
These leaves have a length of about 7 cm.
grow to/reach a length of 2 metres/8 feet etc
A blue whale can reach a length of 100 feet.
run the length of something
A long corridor ran the length of the building.
the total length
The total length of the completed railway line will be almost 650 kilometres.
an average length
These worms grow to an average length of about 1 metre.
the whole/full/entire length of something
The camera looks down the full length of the street.
medium length
All the girls had short or medium length hair.
equal/unequal length
She drew two lines of equal length.
a maximum/minimum length
This species of fish can reach a maximum length of 12 inches.
